instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4942: What is 820-4942? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR: What is PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR? This is the input that comes from the charger..
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Macbook Pro 13 inch that had liquid damage. The old battery was really bad and the liquid was near the battery connector so i orderd a new battery and replaced it but it did not fix the problem. 

I replaced the ISL but it did not help at all. Of course i checked some measurement before replacing but I'm lost right now so i could use your help!

Here are some info:

ISL Pins

17/18 about 5 ohms
27/28 20.7 ohms.

Macsafe charger when plugged turns green and to orange. Sometimes the orange fades away but it does not turn off. MacBook turns off right away when macsafe is removed, so the battery does not keep the computer awake.

Also my charger is new original Apples MagSafe 2 60W charger so this is not fake Chinese charger. :)

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: I think you have two separate issues here. First fix the system side current sensing because 5 ohms is a bit high, and that should hopefully fix the issue with the charger light turning off. Then post the voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and on either side of <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR>/1.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
I measured it now and its about 4.2 ohms. Is it still too high? I still measured the <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> Resistors.

Here are the results.

<RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR> Pin 1 = 3.419V Pin 2 = Changes about in one second all the time from 3.417 to 3.355 and again and again
<RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> Pin 1 = 3.419V same as <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR> Pin 2.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Make sure <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is present when battery is plugged in without charger. 

Make sure you're not using a shit battery!

threads.message: And there is no <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> when the battery is plugged in without the charger...

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: There is no 3V42 because the battery is probably not outputting any voltage. Is there voltage on PPBUS on battery only? If not the battery is just fucked. Just buy another one on Ebay and don't go for the cheapest this time. 90% of these batteries are fine, but of course it is all pulled crap from China.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: Yes, there is PPBUS line when the battery is plugged in without the charger.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
There's a resistor that feeds <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>'s power IC <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> from the battery. Is that working? Do you have input voltage of 12.5v to <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>'s power IC with the battery present? I have no schematics on the laptop I'm on or I'd give you exact numbers. I go over that issue here.

[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u14u1q_GjRg[/url]

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> and <DIODE>D7005</DIODE> feed battery voltage to power 3V42, check those.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
So i checked those [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] and [USER="1"]larossmann[/USER] .

<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>  = 1.295 Volts
<DIODE>D7005</DIODE> PIN 1 = 0.025 Volts
<DIODE>D7005</DIODE> PIN 3 = 1.225 Volts

And i checked the resistors value and it was same as in Schematics. What should i look next?

This is new battery and the results are the same as before, even after replacing SMC.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
[QUOTE="VirtualLife, post: 15932"]
<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> = 1.295 Volts[/QUOTE]

<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>, pin 1, is <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is direct battery voltage. What you're telling me is that your battery is outputting 1.295v instead of 12v, which indicates this is still a shit battery.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: I have checked the board under the microscope and have not seen any waterdamaged areas. The only waterdamaged area was near the battery connector. I have the 3476 brd file but if anyone has the correct one 4942 i can tell you what capasitor was bad, but i still replaced it with the new one.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C7132</CAPACITOR> and its "neighbors" will still keep high tension after charger is dicsonnected for some time...
I think 3787 brd is closer to 4924.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
"For how long?"
Who matters???

Do you also have 12V at F7140, with battery only?
I doubt...

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: Have you actually measured PPBUS? <CAPACITOR>C7132</CAPACITOR> is NOT on PPBUS. F7140 good?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
No i have not. Now i measured it.

F7140 PIN 1 0.5 volts and increases slowly. Pin 2 the same.

F7140 beebs from boths side and its not blown.

Checked with diode mode the PPBUS line and it was 0.146.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: at first when i checked the PPBUS line with diode mode it beeped really long and it started from 1.000 and went down to 0.146 and after that it did stop the beeping.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Same voltage at J7050?
If yes, probably bad battery,
Check <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> too...

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: As there is a Schottky diode involved, 0.146 reading is correct at F7140...

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: I already checked the <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>. It is 10K Ohms and there was 0.1 volts. When i checked the <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> with diode mode it was 2.116 from both sides. And J7050 is good. I have checked if there was under it corrosion but there was not.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: Jesus Christ how hard can this be? IS THERE 12V ON F7140 WITH THE BATTERY PLUGGED IN, NO CHARGER CONNECTED OF COURSE? If yes then there should be 12V getting to <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> or there is a fucked trace.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Battery is not recognized <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4942</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] You are getting angry quite fast. First of all i have already answered your question. There is no need for getting angry. Check the page two for the answer.... if your not up to it. I will copy it for you. :)

No i have not. Now i measured it.

F7140 PIN 1 = 0.5 volts and increases slowly. Pin 2 the same.

F7140 beebs from boths side and its not blown.

Checked with diode mode the PPBUS line and it was 0.146.

AND THERE IS NO CHARGER PLUGGED: ONLY BATTERY.
